enWisdom: Repose is in renouncing worldly pleasures
Renunciation of worldly pleasures is the greatest comfort
Renunciation of worldly pleasures is the better of the two comforts
The fruit of renouncing worldly pleasures is repose

Wisdom: وَمَنْ أَحَبَّ الرَّاحَةَ فَلْيُؤْثِرِ الزُّهْدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: One who loves comfort must prefer abstinence from pleasures in this world
Renunciation of worldly pleasures is affluence
Renunciation of worldly pleasures is a profitable trade
Renunciation of worldly pleasures leads to asceticism

Wisdom: ازْهَدْ فِي الدُّنْيَا تَنْزِلْ عَلَيْكَ الرَّحْمَةُ
enWisdom: Renounce the pleasures of this world and [divine] mercy will descend upon you

Wisdom: ازْهَدْ فِي الدُّنْيَا يُبَصِّرُكَ اللَّهُ عُيُوبَهَا وَلَا تَغْفَلْ فَلَسْتَ بِمَغْفُولٍ عَنْكَ
enWisdom: Renounce [vain] pleasures in this world and Allah will show you its flaws, and do not be negligent, for you are not neglected
The people who are most felicitous are those who are least interested this world

Wisdom: إِنْ كُنْتُمْ فِي الْبَقَاءِ رَاغِبِينَ فَازْهَدُوا فِي عَالَمِ الْفَنَاءِ
enWisdom: If you desire the eternal, then renounce the pleasures of the evanescent world

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِنْ زَهَدْتُمْ خَلَصْتُمْ مِنْ شَقَاءِ الدُّنْيَا وَفُزْتُمْ بِدَارِ الْبَقَاءِ
enWisdom: If you renounce worldly pleasures, you will be free from the wretchedness of this world and prosperous in the everlasting abode
Through renunciation of worldly pleasures, wisdom is brought forth
The price of Paradise is renunciation of the [pleasures of this] world
Every innocent one is well
The innocent one is healthy
He who renounces worldly pleasures will never become poor

Wisdom: لَوْ زَهِدْتُمْ فِي الشَّهَوَاتِ لَسَلِمْتُمْ مِنَ الْآفَاتِ
enWisdom: If you had abstained from lustful desires you would surely have been safe from tribulations
Whoever renounces worldly pleasures, tribulations become easy for him [to bear]
One who continues showing gratitude makes the goodness [and blessing] last

Wisdom: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا حَصَّنَ دِينَهُ
enWisdom: One who renounces pleasures in this world fortifies [and protects] his religion

Wisdom: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا لَمْ تَفُتْهُ
enWisdom: Whoever renounces this world, it will not elude him

Wisdom: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا اسْتَهَانَ بِالْمَصَائِبِ
enWisdom: One who renounces [the pleasures of] this world makes light of the tribulations [he faces in it]

Wisdom: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا أَعْتَقَ نَفْسَهُ وَأَرْضَى رَبَّهُ
enWisdom: One who renounces [the pleasures of] this world frees himself and pleases his Lord

Wisdom: مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا قَرَّتْ عَيْنُهُ بِجَنَّةِ الْمَأْوَى
enWisdom: One who renounces [the pleasures of] this world will be delighted by the garden of the abode [of perpetual bliss in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَزْهَدْ فِي الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ نَصِيبٌ فِي جَنَّةِ الْمَأْوَى
enWisdom: One who does not renounces [the pleasures of] this world will not have a share in the Garden of the Abode
By renouncing worldly pleasures, the fruit of wisdom comes forth
